reviews.review: I think the first movie was so good that it’s hard to top with a second. It was a little darker than I expected as well. I’m glad I took my family to see it but it’s no Toy Story 4!

Gorgeous animation. Kristoff unintentionally steals this film. His song about love and dedication speaks to a greater conversation about relationships and sacrifice. It also goes nicely hand in hand with Olaf’s goofy song about growing up. There’s a greater conversation about change in this film and evoking ‘the unknown’ that is at times reflected in the animation. A massive wall of impenetrable fog, an ice cave that reaches into the depths of the earth. When you reach out into the unknown, it reaches back. Unfortunately Frozen II decides to shelve those conversations about the struggles of change, and the dangers of reaching for answers buried in the past and opts in sisterly love. This wouldn’t be as big of a problem if all those previous conversations weren’t midway through their arcs, then unceremoniously dropped. Frozen II reaches partly into the unknown, but doesn’t let the unknown reach back.
We liked the music and Olaf and Sven and baby reindeer and the fire salamander. We did not like our seats because we were too close.
Great animation and a better plot
It was a great Disney movie. Great story also.
Loved the storyline. Answered some questions.

wow, a disney sequel that not only avoided the direct-to-video syndrome, but managed to be even better than the first.  i'm a 40+ yr old white dude (in case anybody cares), and got emotionally choked up many times, and almost yelled "YES!" in the theater a few times more.  Well done, Disney!  i will watch this one again.
A bizarre, emotionally overwrought movie that seems designed to fill Disneys SJW propaganda mission.
As per tradtion with Frozen, I ugly cried in the last half minutes of the movie easily. It was just as good in my mind as the first was and is hands down my favorite movie of 2019!
It was better than the first movie! Graphics and music was exceptional. Great movie for the family with all ages of children.
